SEARCH
Package pointOfSales

Class managerPageController

java.lang.Object
pointOfSales.managerPageController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class managerPageController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The managerPageController function handles all the logic that for the manager page The logic includes but is not limited to switching active scenes/AnchorPanes. Initializing, inputting, and clearing table values. Keeping track of dynamic buttons and order details Calling backend functions to add data to the database and get data from the database.

    • handleCancelButton

      public void handleCancelButton()
      The handleCancelButton function clears all relevant variables, labels, and tables. So the next order starts off as if no order was made before it.

    • checkoutButton

      public void checkoutButton()
      The checkoutButton function is the handler for the checkout button on the sidebar. This function turns the visibilty of all other UI elements off and all of the UI for the checkout menu on. The function also clears any left over values in the table that may be there before navigating off the checkout menu.
      See Also:
      • setUpTeaPane()

    • handleAddInventory

      public void handleAddInventory()
      The handleAddInventory function is the handler for the add inventory button on the inventory management page. This function adds whatever values were entered into the textfields to the database and refreshes the table
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the values that were pulled from the database cannot be converted to doubles.
      See Also:
      • SystemFunctions.getInventory()
      • SystemFunctions.updateInventory(String, Integer)

    • handleDeleteInventory

      public void handleDeleteInventory()
      The handleDeleteInventory function deletes an item from the inventory based off of the values in the text fields
      See Also:
      • SystemFunctions.deleteInventory(String)
      • SystemFunctions.getInventory()

    • handleAddProduct

      public void handleAddProduct()
      The handleAddProduct function is the handler for the add product button. This function adds a new product to the database and updates the table immediately to display the new item
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the data from the database cannot be converted to a value of double
      See Also:
      • SystemFunctions.updateAddProduct(String, String, Double)
      • SystemFunctions.getProducts()

    • handleDeleteProduct

      public void handleDeleteProduct()
      The handleDeleteProduct function is the handler for the delete button on the product management page. This function deletes a product from the database and updates the table to show the change in the UI.
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - in case a value cannot be converted to a double
      See Also:
      • SystemFunctions.deleteProduct(String)
      • SystemFunctions.getProducts()

    • handleClearInventory

      public void handleClearInventory()
      The handleClearInventory function is the handler for the clear button on the inventory management page. This function clears the textfields on the inventory management page.

    • handleClearProduct

      public void handleClearProduct()
      The handleClearProduct function is the handler for the clear button on the product management page. This function clears the textfields on the product management page.

    • handleStatPage

      public void handleStatPage()
      The handleStatPage function is the handler for the statistics button on the right nav bar. This function turns off the visibility of all UI elements and turns on the UI elements that the stat page should only display
      See Also:
      • initializeExcessTable()
      • initializePairTable()
      • initializeRestockTable()
      • handleRestockReport()

    • handleSalesReport

      public void handleSalesReport()
      The handleSalesReport function is the handler for the generate sales report button. This function takes the entries from the 2 dates the user entered in the UI and creates a bar graph displaying how each product performed in sales over that given time period
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - fails in formatting the dates correctly
      See Also:
      • SystemFunctions.getProductSales(String, String)

    • handleExcessReport

      public void handleExcessReport()
      The handleExcessReport function is the handler for the date entry field. This function when a date is entered attempts to display the excess stock for that day in the excess table
      See Also:
      • SystemFunctions.getExcessStock(String)

    • handlePopularPair

      public void handlePopularPair()
      The handlePopularPair function is a handler for the generate report button in the popular pair field. This function takes 2 dates from datefields and ranks the 2 most often sold products together from greatest to least. Then it displays the ranking in a table
      See Also:
      • SystemFunctions.getPairs(String, String)

    • handleRestockReport

      public void handleRestockReport()
      The handleRestockReport function determines whether or not items are passed the threshold determined in the database to be restocked and if there are any items, then they are displayed in a table.
      See Also:
      • SystemFunctions.getLowStock()

    • handleOrdersButton

      public void handleOrdersButton()
      The handleOrdersButton is the handler for the orders button on the right nav bar. This function toggles the visibility of all UI elements not on that page off and toggles on all the UI elements that are on the page. It also initializes the tables on the page.
      See Also:
      • initializeOrderHistoryTable()
      • initializeHistoryInfoTable()

    • handleGenerateOrderHistory

      public void handleGenerateOrderHistory()
      The handleGenerateOrderHistory function is the handler for the generate button on the orders page. This function takes a date window and adds 25 orders to the orderHistory table.
      See Also:
      • SystemFunctions.getOrdersByDates(String, String)

    • handleForwardHistory

      public void handleForwardHistory()
      The handleForwardHistory function is the handler for the next button on the orders page. This function grabs the next 1 <= x <= 25 values from the array that was generated by handleGenerateOrderHistory. Then it clears the table and displays the next 25 values.

    • handleBackwardHistory

      public void handleBackwardHistory()
      The handleBackwardHistory function is the handler for the prev button on the orders page. This function grabs the previous 25 values and loads them into the table.

    • initializeHistoryInfoTable

      public void initializeHistoryInfoTable()
      The initializeHistoryInfoTable function initializes the historyInfoTable so values can be added to it.

    • handleHistoryTableClick

      public void handleHistoryTableClick(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      The handleHistoryTableClick function is the handler the order history table. This function whenever a row is selected on the table, it adds the details of the order to the order history info table to show what was ordered and how much it cost.
      Parameters:
      event - is used to make sure that a row was clicked
      See Also:
      • SystemFunctions.getOrderProductByID(Integer)

      public void handleSalesButton()
      The handleSalesButton function switches the panes on the stat page between the product usage report and the sales report

    • handleUsage

      public void handleUsage()
      The handleUsage function adds values to the Usage table. The table returns values of the change in the inventory over a time window
      See Also:
      • SystemFunctions.getInventoryUsage(String, String)
